title: ‘Physical relations’ cannot automatically mean sexual assault, rules Delhi High court - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘Physical relations’ cannot automatically mean sexual assault, rules Delhi High court

Publication Date: Dec 29, 2024 - Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi High Court acquitted a man accused under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act (POCSO), stating that the phrase 'physical relations' used by the minor cannot automatically be interpreted as sexual assault. The court highlighted the need for concrete evidence rather than assumptions in such cases.

  • The ruling was made by Justices Pratibha M Singh and Amit Sharma.
  • The accused had initially been sentenced to life imprisonment.
  • The court emphasized the absence of clarity on the term 'physical relations' as used by the minor.
The court stated, "The mere fact that the survivor is below 18 years cannot lead to a conclusion that there was penetrative sexual assault."

This ruling raises important questions about definitions and interpretations in sexual assault cases, especially regarding minors. The court's decision to acquit the accused based on the nuances of language highlights the complexities involved in such legal matters.
newTitle: Delhi High Court Rules on Definition of Sexual Assault

title: Pranab Mukherjee's daughter takes ‘real rot’ jibe at Congress: ‘Why no CWC…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sharmistha Mukherjee Criticizes Congress Over CWC Meeting for Her Father's Death

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Sharmistha Mukherjee, daughter of the late former president Pranab Mukherjee, has expressed her dissatisfaction with the Congress party for not convening a Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting to mourn her father’s death in August 2020. She criticized the party’s current state and called for introspection.

  • Mukherjee stated that Congress workers feel alienated from the leadership.
  • She compared the absence of a condolence meeting for her father to past practices regarding deceased leaders.
  • Sharmistha accused Congress of trolling her over her comments about the party’s direction.
  • Her remarks highlight a rift between party ideology and current leadership approaches.
“There is a real rot in the Congress,” said Mukherjee regarding the party's handling of her father's death.

In conclusion, Sharmistha Mukherjee’s comments indicate a significant discontent with the direction of the Congress party and the perceived neglect of traditional practices.
newTitle: Sharmistha Mukherjee Criticizes Congress Over CWC Meeting for Her Father's Death

title: Outgoing Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan bids adieu to the State, CM Pinarayi Vijayan absent for farewell - The Hindu
summary:
Outgoing Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan bids adieu to the State, CM Pinarayi Vijayan absent for farewell

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Outgoing Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan has left the State after a politically tumultuous tenure, moving on to become the new Governor of Bihar. His departure comes without a ceremonial farewell from Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan and cabinet members.

  • Arif Mohammad Khan often clashed with the Left Democratic Front (LDF) government during his five-year tenure.
  • He was mobbed by journalists at the Thiruvananthapuram airport and declined to comment on the lack of a farewell.
  • Khan expressed that he was leaving Kerala with fond memories and only had “good words for everybody.”
  • His departure was marked by political drama, including a farewell from student activists.
“It is odious to compare two individuals. Each have their individuality and execute their duties according to their respective convictions.” - Arif Mohammad Khan

The absence of a state farewell contrasts sharply with the grand send-off given to his predecessor, P. Sathasivam, which highlights the political tensions during Khan's term.
newTitle: Outgoing Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan bids adieu to the State, CM Pinarayi Vijayan absent for farewell

title: Delivery Boy To Civil Judge – A Story That Inspires - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Delivery Boy To Civil Judge – A Story That Inspires

Publication Date: 2024
Source: LiveLaw

The inspiring story of Advocate Yaseen Shan Muhammed, who overcame significant hardships to secure the second rank in the Kerala Judicial Services Examinations 2024 and qualify as a Civil Judge.

  • Yaseen faced economic challenges as a child, working various jobs including as a delivery boy.
  • He had limited educational support and was a below-average student early on.
  • After multiple attempts, he cleared the judicial service exam with the help of mentors and guidance.
  • Yaseen emphasizes the importance of hard work and understanding legal material deeply.
  • He aims to represent those from similar disadvantaged backgrounds and wishes to pursue post-graduate studies in law.
“I want to work by being part of the system. I will do my job honestly, sincerely, and as per my conscience.”

Yaseen's story highlights resilience and the role of empowerment in achieving one's dreams.
newTitle: Delivery Boy To Civil Judge – A Story That Inspires

Karnataka contractor death: Case registered against six people, including Minister Priyank Kharge’s close aide - Hindustan Times
summary:
Karnataka Contractor's Death: Case Filed Against Close Aide of Minister Priyank Kharge

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The case revolves around the tragic death of Sachin Panchal, a contractor from Bidar, who allegedly ended his life by lying in front of a train. He left a suicide note accusing Minister Priyank Kharge’s aide and others of making death threats against him.

  • A case has been registered against Raju Kapanur and five accomplices for conspiracy related to deaths of political figures.
  • Panchal's suicide note implicated Kapanur, alleging death threats and a plot to harm BJP leaders.
  • Minister Eshwar Khandre visited Panchal's family, promising justice and compensation of ₹10 lakh.
  • BJP has called for a CBI investigation, citing serious allegations from the suicide note.
  • Priyank Kharge defended himself against accusations, stating his name was not mentioned in the note.
"The government will ensure that justice is done, and the accused persons are punished. Government is with you," - Minister Eshwar Khandre

This incident highlights the serious political implications and personal tragedies in Karnataka as the investigation continues.
newTitle: Karnataka Contractor's Death: Case Filed Against Close Aide of Minister Priyank Kharge

title: 'Hope Congress Stops Exploiting…': BJP's Rebuttal On Row Over Manmohan Singh Funeral - News18
136 Vande Bharat trains serving aspirational Indians with modern comfortable rail travel | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
136 Vande Bharat Trains Transform Indian Rail Travel

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: ANI

Indian Railways has introduced 136 Vande Bharat trains, marking significant modernization in rail travel for India.

  • As of December 26, 2024, 136 Vande Bharat trains are operational.
  • 62 of these services were launched in 2024 alone.
  • Features include Kavach technology, accessible toilets, and Braille signage.
  • 3,210 kilometers of rail track electrified in 2024, with 97% of the broad gauge network electrified.
  • 1,337 stations are identified for redevelopment under the Amrit Bharat Station Scheme.
  • Indian Railways aims to be a Net Zero Carbon Emitter by 2030.
  • Total capital expenditure for 2024-25 is ₹2,65,200 crores.
  • E-ticketing has reached 86% in reserved sectors.
  • Gati Shakti Multi-Modal Cargo Terminals are being developed at 354 locations.
  • Three Economic Corridors sanctioned in 2024 are under development with a total of 434 projects planned.
“The Vande Bharat trains have become a symbol of India's aspirations for modern, efficient, and comfortable rail travel.”

This initiative by Indian Railways highlights its commitment to modernization and enhancing passenger experience in rail travel.
newTitle: 136 Vande Bharat Trains Transform Indian Rail Travel

title: ‘Cong creating controversy over Manmohan Singh's funeral', says Union minister Hardeep Puri - Hindustan Times
summary:
Controversy Erupts Over Manmohan Singh's Funeral, Claims Union Minister Hardeep Puri

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A heated exchange has unfolded between the BJP and Congress regarding the cremation of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, who passed away at the age of 92. Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri criticized Congress for allegedly politicizing the situation and establishing a memorial for Singh.

  • Puri accused Congress of creating unnecessary controversy over Singh's funeral arrangements.
  • The former PM was cremated with full state honors at Delhi's Nigambodh Ghat, attended by top dignitaries.
  • Rahul Gandhi expressed that Singh was insulted by the government's arrangements for his last rites.
  • Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma condemned Congress for politicizing the situation.
“Dr. Manmohan Singh, a statesman of unparalleled dignity and intellect, deserved much better... It is deeply disheartening to witness the Congress Party attempting to stir controversy.” - Himanta Biswa Sarma

The exchanges highlight the ongoing political tensions in India, particularly regarding the legacy of Manmohan Singh and how his passing is being handled by different political factions.
newTitle: Controversy Erupts Over Manmohan Singh's Funeral, Claims Union Minister Hardeep Puri

title: Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) to be inaugurated on April 17, domestic flights from May - The Times of India
summary:
Navi Mumbai International Airport to Open on April 17 with Domestic Flights Starting in May

Publication Date: April 3, 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) is set to be inaugurated on April 17, and domestic flights will commence in May, marking a significant development in India's aviation sector.

  • The airport will enhance connectivity for citizens in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region.
  • It aims to ease traffic at the existing Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport.
  • The project is expected to benefit economic growth in the area, creating jobs and improving local infrastructure.
  • Authorities emphasize the airport’s potential to handle the increasing air travel demand.
"This airport will play a vital role in boosting our local economy and improving accessibility for the citizens." - Airport Authority representative

The NMIA's inauguration is anticipated to significantly improve air travel in the region, providing a much-needed alternative for travelers.
newTitle: Navi Mumbai International Airport to Open on April 17 with Domestic Flights Starting in May

title: First commercial flight landing at Navi Mumbai airport today - The Indian Express
summary:
First Commercial Flight Lands at Navi Mumbai Airport

Date: Sunday, December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The Navi Mumbai International Airport has successfully witnessed its first commercial aircraft landing, marking a significant milestone in the airport's development.

  • An Indigo A320 aircraft landed at the newly constructed runway of Navi Mumbai airport.
  • The landing was part of a trial testing program managed by Mumbai Air Traffic Control.
  • The Navi Mumbai airport is expected to be operational by early 2025, aiming to handle 60 million passengers annually.
  • The airport will feature two parallel runways, facilitating simultaneous operations and advanced infrastructure.
  • Previously, an IAF C-295 aircraft had successfully landed as part of ongoing testing activities.
"The Navi Mumbai International Airport will become one of the largest greenfield international airports in India." - Indian Express

In conclusion, the successful landing not only demonstrates the operational readiness of the airport but also paves the way for future flights and operational activities.
newTitle: First Commercial Flight Lands at Navi Mumbai Airport

Former IPS officer deputed as OSD on Ayodhya dispute Acharya Kishore Kunal dies of heart attack in Patna - The Hindu
summary:
Remembering Acharya Kishore Kunal: Former IPS Officer and Religious Leader Passes Away

Published on: December 29, 2024, Source: The Hindu

Acharya Kishore Kunal, a former IPS officer and founder secretary of Mahavir Mandir Trust, died of a heart attack in Patna.

  • Kunal served in the Gujarat cadre and was the Patna Senior Superintendent of Police from 1983-84.
  • He was appointed officer of special duty on the Ayodhya dispute during the tenures of former PMs V.P. Singh and Chandra Shekhar.
  • He authored several books, including the notable 'Ayodhya Revisited'.
  • Kunal played a key role in appointing Dalit priests in temples and advocated for Dalit rights through his writings.
  • His contributions led to the construction and renovation of many temples across Bihar.
“His demise has caused irreparable loss in the administrative, social and religious field,” said Chief Minister Nitish Kumar.

Kunal's legacy includes his advocacy for social justice and his role in temple construction, reflecting his commitment to both governance and spirituality.
newTitle: Remembering Acharya Kishore Kunal: Former IPS Officer and Religious Leader Passes Away

title: Two WDs likely to hit J&K from Jan 1, bring more snow: MeT - Greater Kashmir
Boy who fell into borewell in Madhya Pradesh’s Guna dies - The Hindu
summary:
Boy who fell into borewell in Madhya Pradesh’s Guna dies

Date: December 29, 2024 Source: The Hindu

A tragic incident occurred in Madhya Pradesh’s Guna district where a 10-year-old boy, Sumit Meena, lost his life after falling into a 140-feet borewell. Despite extensive rescue efforts lasting 16 hours, he was declared unresponsive upon retrieval.

  • Sumit fell into the borewell around 5 p.m. on December 28, 2024, in Pipliya village.
  • Rescue operations included the National Disaster Response Force and involved digging a parallel pit.
  • Sumit was trapped at a depth of 39 feet for the entire night before being retrieved.
  • Medical examination indicated he had endured hypothermia and was unresponsive upon being brought out.
  • The borewell had not been properly secured as it did not strike water.
“Sorry to say, he is no more,” Guna district chief medical and health officer Dr. Rajkumar Rishishwar told reporters.

This tragic accident raises concerns regarding child safety and the need for better securing of borewells to prevent similar incidents in the future.
newTitle: Tragic Incident: 10-Year-Old Boy Dies After Falling into Borewell in Madhya Pradesh

Four arrested for siphoning off ₹12.5 cr from CRED, Bengaluru police uncover major crime: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Four Arrested for Embezzling ₹12.5 Crore from CRED in Bengaluru

Publication Date: Dec 29, 2024 11:08 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

CRED, a fintech company, uncovered a significant fraud involving ₹12.5 crore during a bank reconciliation on November 13, leading to the arrest of four suspects from Gujarat.

  • The main suspect, Vaibhav Pitadiya, exploited his bank position.
  • Fraudulent activities involved forging Corporate Internet Banking documents.
  • Authorities recovered ₹1.83 crore of the stolen amount.
  • Seventeen unauthorized transactions occurred from October 29 to November 11.
  • The investigation continues to identify further accomplices.
"The investigation is ongoing, with efforts underway to recover the remaining stolen funds and identify any additional accomplices."

This incident highlights vulnerabilities in cybersecurity and the importance of routine audits in financial institutions.
newTitle: Four Arrested for Embezzling ₹12.5 Crore from CRED in Bengaluru

summary:
Tourist Warning as Major Snowfall Strands Vehicles in Manali and Solang Valley

Publication Date: December 28, 2023 | Source: Live Mint

A severe snowfall in Manali and Solang Valley has left over 1800 vehicles stranded, leading a social media user to warn potential tourists against visiting the area.

As conditions worsen, a social media influencer named Chlucky Tyagi advised people to stay away, stating, 'koi bhi mat aana! (Do not come!)' In a video shared, he captured the long line of stationary cars.

  • Over 2000 vehicles stuck due to heavy snowfall.
  • Social media warnings to avoid travel to affected areas.
  • Rescue operations led by Himachal Police, with around 1800 vehicles evacuated.
  • Continuing snowfall expected over the next few days.
'We have launched a rescue operation after over 2000 vehicles were stuck,' - Manali DSP KD Sharma.

This incident highlights the impact of adverse weather conditions on travel and safety in the region, reinforcing the importance of heeding local advisories during extreme weather events.
newTitle: Tourist Warning as Major Snowfall Strands Vehicles in Manali and Solang Valley

title: Perplexity AI CEO meets PM Modi for a ‘great conversation’; netizens wonder ‘Is this AI generated?’ | Mint - Mint
summary:
Perplexity AI CEO meets PM Modi for a ‘great conversation’

Publication Date: [Insert publication date here] Source: [Insert source here]

Perplexity AI CEO Aravind Srinivas held a significant meeting with Prime Minister Modi to discuss artificial intelligence adoption both in India and globally.

  • Aravind Srinivas shared details of the meeting on his X (formerly Twitter) account, expressing his admiration for PM Modi's vision and dedication to AI.
  • PM Modi acknowledged Srinivas' work and the importance of discussions on AI.
